alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 12:00PM PST until December 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...NEXT STORM SYSTEM TO BRING SNOW TO THE SAN BERNARDINO AND RIVERSIDE COUNTY MOUNTAINS SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT NOON PST TODAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Tree branches could fall as well. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches Saturday night and Sunday morning, with localized amounts up to 12 inches, are possible. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Mountains. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant reductions in visibility are possible. Snow level will be mostly be around 5000 feet with this storm. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains
